channel.title: Editing .rscd files
channel.description: I have edited the server side files and re-compressed them into *.gz that's all good. But now I am trying to edit the client side I can decompress *.rscd file edit it but can't figure out how to re-compress it into an *.rscd file... i been looking for 4 hours!!! help plz!

item.title: Editing .rscd files
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:9, topic:333028”][quote author=darscape link=topic=429451.msg3152982#msg3152982 date=1268745344]
yeah, just rename to .rscd from .xml.gz
[/quote]

Wth are you talking about?[/quote]

I really hope you are joking.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .rscd files
item.dc:creator: @Nuk Nuk
item.description:
@Nuk wrote:

If you use compression tool,
1.Grab .rscd file and place it in input
2.Decompress all.
3.Go to output folder and now you can edit the .rscd file as you wish
4.Once you have finished editing, copy it to input folder
5.Press compress all

Read full topic

Yes, if ever in doubt, check the file size.

item.title: Editing .rscd files
item.dc:creator: @Destined Destined
item.description:
@Destined wrote:

OMG I’m such a n00b, yeah i already tried that several times… Trouble was i was expecting to see a different type (like *.xml) of file in the output directory, when i saw the *.rscd file i just automatically thought it didn’t work, it did decompress, it was just the same file extension… When i tried it again i saw the file size had changed… Just something i overlooked.

Cheers Yong Min…

Thanks for putting up with my n00bness and for replying

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .rscd files
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

As I said, just use the compression tool.

Put the .rscd file into the input folder, double click the decompress_all.bat, edit it in the output folder, copy and paste it into the input folder once you’ve edited it, hit the compress_all.bat and then it’s back in the output folder ready to be copy and pasted back into your client.

7-zip never worked for me, compression tool works great.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .rscd files
item.dc:creator: @Destined Destined
item.description:
@Destined wrote:

I’m trying to edit the client side, i’ve already edited the *.xml file for the server side, by decompressing the *.gz file into the *.xml, editing the *.xml then re-compressing it into a *.gz file.

My problem lies with the *.rscd files… I decompress the *.rscd file with 7-zip and it comes out into an *.xml… Thats all well and good… I edit the *.xml… But when i use the compression tool to re-compress it, it compresses into a *.gz file, not an *.rscd file.

I don’t know how to compress into the *.rscd files…

Read full topic

item.title: Editing .rscd files
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Use the compression tool. Throw it in the input folder and compress it.

Read full topic
